marytts.fst
Class FSTLookup

java.lang.Object
  marytts.fst.FSTLookup

public class FSTLookup
extends java.lang.Object

An implementation of a finite state transducer lookup.

Author:
Andreas Eisele

Constructor Detail

FSTLookup

public FSTLookup(java.lang.String fileName)
          throws java.io.IOException
Initialise the finite state transducer lookup. This constructor will assume that the file uses the system default encoding.

Parameters:
fileName - the name of the file from which to load the FST.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the FST cannot be loaded from the given file.

FSTLookup

public FSTLookup(java.lang.String fileName,
                 java.lang.String encoding)
          throws java.io.IOException,
                 java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
Initialise the finite state transducer lookup.

Parameters:
fileName - the name of the file from which to load the FST.
encoding - the name of the encoding used in the file (e.g., UTF-8 or ISO-8859-1).
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if the FST cannot be loaded from the given file.
java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException - if the encoding is not supported.
Method Detail

lookup

public java.lang.String[] lookup(java.lang.String word)
Look up a word in the FST. The FST runs in normal mode, i.e. it generates the expanded forms from the original forms. This method is thread-safe.

Parameters:
word - the word to look up.
Returns:
a string array containing all expansions of word. If no expansion is found, an array of length 0 is returned.

lookup

public java.lang.String[] lookup(java.lang.String word,
                                 boolean generate)
Look up a word in the FST. This method is thread-safe.

Parameters:
word - the word to look up.
generate - whether the FST is to run in inverse direction, i.e. generating the original form from the expanded form.
Returns:
a string array containing all expansions of word. If no expansion is found, an array of length 0 is returned.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException
A simple command-line frontend for the FST.

Throws:
java.io.IOException
